item.title: Kestrel Windhover, or Kiting
item.description: Kestrels are often identified by their iconic flying behaviour – giving it one of its old nicknames: the 'windhover'. The kestrel has the incredible ability to keep its head still while hovering in a single spot to pinpoint its prey. They hover by flying into the oncoming wind at the same speed as the air current. In fact, they're flying forward, but the wind resistance creates a hovering effect. As such, kestrels have slightly stiffer feathers than other birds of prey to withstand these strong winds.

item.title: Les Beaux Frères – Les Serviettes
item.description: From the TV show: Plus Grand Cabaret Du Monde Yohann Trépanier and Raphaël Dubé are Canadian acrobats who performed in 2014 under the name Les Beaux Frères. They continue to tour internationally with productions such as "Ohlala - Sexy - Crazy - Artistic," and their work combines strength, grace, and technical precision, often presented in visually refined routines.

item.title: GovBrief Today #339
item.description: Marco Rubio told you why we attacked Venezuela. Asked on Meet the Press about elections in the country we just invaded, the Secretary of State said discussing them is "premature." Higher priorities than democracy, he explained, including reinvigorating the oil industry, must be addressed first. There's nothing ambiguous when the nation's top diplomat says on national television that American oil companies will rebuild the infrastructure and, in Trump's words, "start making money." Meanwhile, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem announced that the 600,000 Venezuelans whose protected status she ended can now apply for refugee status. By refugee status, she means from us. We've emailed 5,400+ stories over 339 straight nights. Stop hoping the algorithm shows them to you. govbrief.today #GovBriefToday #Resist Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com [1] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-hortman-conspiracy [2] https://go.govbrief.today/denmark-greenland-venezuela [3] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-russian-claim-home [4] https://go.govbrief.today/maduro-cuba-deaths [5] https://go.govbrief.today/rubio-venezuela-leverage [6] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-threatens-latin-america [7] https://go.govbrief.today/delcy-rodriguez-control [8] https://go.govbrief.today/us-venezuela-refuge Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com

item.title: PTGDump: Memes I Send My Wife Vol. IX
item.description:
Hello everyone! Hooray for penis!
Oddly enough, the goblin is her and not me.
Some friends of ours had very involved and complicated NYE plans. My wife and I stayed at home, ate too much cheese, and went to bed at, like, ten.
I am her.
My wife is a redhead. She doesn't really have that much of an attitude, but when she does... hoo boy.
We're actually trying to stop doing this so much.
Squirrel you know it's true
Why would anyone want to change this person's mind about this?
Both are good.
THIS HAPPENS TO MY WIFE ALL THE TIME. The smartspeaker BARELY recognizes her, but it obeys me 100% of the time.
'Tis!
Straight caviar with a spoon? Blech. You need a cracker for that business.
I got a hug after sending her this. THE MEMES ARE WORKING.
Bleh bleh bleh.
True.
... and I will do all these things WHILE banging.
Us if we were owls and we were also married.
In this respect, I am the goblin. Marriage is accepting that you are both goblins in your own ways.
I did not see boobs after sending her this. The fact that we were out at dinner with the kid shouldn't be a factor.
No sir they are not.
(I would never do this.)
I feel like this era of hipster has passed.
Not body shaming, but that bikini gal is very thin and I would be afraid to hug her because I am very tall and bear-shaped.
I sent her this because a friend of ours recent got a (very much needed) divorce. But she laughed at this maybe a little TOO hard.
Mission recently accomplished.
Everyone must enjoy this modern Rice
I'm so sorry.
Read right to left!
This is a motto of mine.
Y'all are like iguanas, man.
All wonderful advice.
Thanks for reading! MV edit: Thanks for the accolades everyone. Hope you all are having a solid 2026 so far, despite the (gestures vaguely). Send me some recipes you want to try making this year, and I'll send you pictures of the arcade cabinet I'm building. Deal?

item.title: Astronomers witness a newborn planet emerging from the dust around a sun-like star
item.description: The Very Large Telescope in Chile has found, for the first time, an infant planet nestled in spiral arms of dust around a distant sun-like star. Deep within a swirling disk of gas and dust around the star HD 135344B, a young planet appears to be sculpting intricate spiral arms around its stellar host. It is the first time a planet has been found embedded inside a dust spiral around a star, actively shaping its environment. The discovery is further proof that the building blocks of planets emerge from protoplanetary disks — giant, doughnut-shaped disks of gas and dust that circle young stars, according to NASA. These dense, rotating clouds of material around young stars have been seen to feature rings and spirals suspected to be caused by the presence of baby planets, but this is the first direct evidence. In fact, the sculpted protoplanetary disk around the host star, HD 135344B, had been seen before by astronomers using the SPHERE (Spectro-Polarimetric High-contrast Exoplanet Research) instrument on the European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope in Chile. However, by using a new instrument called the Enhanced Resolution Imager and Spectrograph (ERIS), scientists finally discovered a planetary candidate. The planet is nestled at the base of one spiral arm — exactly where models predicted a planet would be needed to generate such a feature — and is thought to be twice the size of Jupiter. It's about as far from its host star as Neptune is from the sun, or about 30 times the distance from Earth to the sun. "What makes this detection potentially a turning point is that, unlike many previous observations, we are able to directly detect the signal of the protoplanet, which is still highly embedded in the disc," Francesco Maio, a doctoral researcher at the University of Florence and lead author of a study describing the discovery The existence of many exoplanets — planets that orbit a star other than the sun — is inferred from other information, such as the dip in a star's brightness that is assumed to be caused by a planet. Observing the planet's own light — reflected light from its host star — gives the proto-planet’s discoverers a much higher level of confidence in its existence. https://www.livescience.com/space/astronomy/astronomers-witness-a-newborn-planet-emerging-from-the-dust-around-a-sun-like-star-space-photo-of-the-week

item.title: Agricultural dump of farming things. Harvesters and drones. Peace and love on earth, please.

Agricultural drone
Spraying rice farms using drones.
Farmers pollinating paddy fields with rope pulling method.
A machine to trim tree avenues.
Farm work, sunshine, and chickens.
Safe Freedom.
Butternut squash.
Harvesting Olives.
How carrots are harvested.
Pistachio harvester.
Potato harvest in action.
Sod harvester.
This is a highly efficient tomato color sorter.
Indian runner ducks going in the field to clean the crops by eating pests like slugs, snails, and beetles, and by providing natural fertilizer through their droppings.
LaserWeeder G2 at work, removing weeds without any chemical use.
New Multifunctional Feed Pellet Machine for Profitable Livestock Farming.
Plowing land with agricultural machinery.
Row cover hoop placement tool.
Seed planting jig at a Nursery.
Sometimes all it takes is a little creativity to make life easier.
Tidying up pine straw.
Very fast packaging of fruits in boxes.
